Coronado Island.name: Coronado Island
reviews:
My boyfriend and I were visiting San Diego from NY, and have heard lovely things about this place. We easily got over to the island by ferry (tickets cost about $10) round trip. There are several restaurants, shops, beaches, and outdoor activities. We walked to everything we needed to see, including the Hotel Del Coronado, which is on the other side of the island. However, you can rent bikes by the hour which is a great way to get to different places. I highly recommend the restaurant “Tartine,” and checking out Coronado beach.
Show less
This is just a very nice place, with lots of restaurants and things to do. It's all very pretty and picturesque.

It's been a number of years since I've been to Coronado. We went and just enjoyed the beautiful weather and watched the waves. The crowd was nice and quiet for the most part. Every now and then there was a rowdy bunch. The one thing that I couldn't get over was all the fake grass. I wonder why they went with some fake grass....Certainly worth going for a day of relaxation.
Show less
Took the ferry over and uber/walked to the other end of the island where we could explore more. A lot of little shops, food and beautiful views.
Visited here and really liked it. I was actually surprised at the amount of sand dollars we found on the island. What else is great is the gold/glitter in the beach sand. It's just amazing.
The entire island is beautiful. From the million dollar homes, to the Hotel Del and the beaches. It can get crowded with traffic and people, but don’t let that detour you from its beauty.
We have never enjoyed a vacation more. The receptionist all went out of their way to make sure we had all that we needed. The bikes were great. Don’t want to go anywhere else.

The beach here was clean, beautiful, and uncrowded (in February). Bike rental in the town area was not expensive, but didn't open until 10 a.m. The bike path down the length of the island was flat and very nice, although there were lots of bike teams riding en masse that were constantly passing me. Highly recommended.
Show less
One of the most beautiful places around. Friendly people and lots of eateries. Most people walk or bike around. Very clean.

Coronado Island is a wonderful place to spend a day, a week, or a lifetime! After a short ferry ride from San Diego one arrives on the shore of this historic and beautiful island community. While some catch a trolley or walk down the main street to the heart of the island we often take a longer route through the quite and pristine neighborhoods of Coronado. So peaceful and relaxing as we wind our way toward the beach at the Hotel Del. Lots of restaurants and shops dot the island’s main business district. Coronado Island is the centerpiece of everyone of our San Diego vacations.
Show less
A must when visiting San Diego

We took the ferry from Harborside to the Island. Walked around the ferry landing area and then to the Coronado Hotel for lunch and drinks.Used ferry tickets on water taxi for return trip to Convention center.

Coronado Island is a beautiful place! Although I am a little biased because I got married there! The beaches are extremely clean and there is no riff-raff. We got married in front of the Hotel Del Coronado, which is absolutely breathtaking. We arrived around 6:00 PM and most people were beginning to clear out which made it nice for our ceremony. Also, the NAVY Seals train on Coronado Island. So, you will see and hear the training taking place.
Show less
Can't Visit San Diego Without A Day in Coronado
Beautiful, fresh air, clean... great beach and small town feel. Love coming here each time I'm in San Diego.
Excellent views, food and relaxation! Walked the beach. Caught a glimpse of a seal swimming. Watched a navy ship dock. Had a wonderful time while there.

We took an uber over to Coronado and the ferry boat back downtown. A lovely spot to walk along the boardwalk on the water. The beach is clean and very large. A beautiful spot to relax! Also nice boutiques along Orange Ave, as well as fun restaurants. Suggest Leroy's for lunch. Overall, glad we visited! Suggest setting aside about 3 hours to wander around.
Show less

Took the Old Town Trolley to Coronado Island and spent a few hours exploring the area. There are many cute boutique type stores, restaurants etc to visit. Take the time to walk through the Hotel del Coronado, certainly worth the time. Had lunch at a little pub across from the hotel, very good to say the least.
Show less

Was told I had to go to Coranado, and I am glad I did. Stunning drive over the bridge, and the beach was beautiful, even on a mild January day. Parking was a challenge, but the beach and ocean are worth it.
Very beautiful Place to visit and spend whole day ! Must watch the sunset, it’s an amazing view ! Love the Island.
We had a wonderful morning walking by the beautifully kept beach. Sea was gorgeous. Coronado itself has quaint neighbourhoods and plenty of coffee shops and restaurants. An easy drive from San Diego.

Coronado is a small jem. There is a fair amount of daily traffic to and from the air base, but the beautiful beaches, eclectic houses, and unique restaurants just can't be beat.

With the gorgeous weather and laid back attitude you can feel the stress just melt away.
Show less
A MUST When in San Diego

Coronado is just a beautiful place to see whether you are visiting during the warm months or not. We were in San Diego in January, and the temps were in the low 60s and it was overcast during out visit. Didn't matter. Coronado was still worth your time.

The island is easy to get to. We took a Lyft from our hotel (Hilton Garden Inn), and the ride was around $13 and 15-20 minutes. Just riding over the bridge to Coronado is an experience! You could spend lots of time wandering the downtown area, shopping and grabbing a bite to eat, but I would recommend heading to the Hotel Coronado and the surrounding beach.

The hotel is such an impressive site. Over 130 years old, it's scale is just amazing! Try to get into the hotel to visit the lower level and walk around the exterior. There are shops and restaurants. You can stop, grab a bite and take in the amazing views. Then take a walk on the beach. It wasn't sunning or swimming weather during our visit, but that didn't stop us from walking on the beach, dipping our feet in the water and just taking in the views from the sand. (Be prepared for the juxtaposition of Navy jets flying overhead as there is a Naval base on the island. Those jets are very loud.)

In short, it's worth your time - whether you want to spend the day or just a couple of hours, add it to your list of places to visit.
Show less

Such a lovely beach. Hotel del is beautiful and has great ice cream to buy and watch the sunset. Rent a bike and enjoy the whole day. Ferry landing also has nice group of shops and dining. Everyone should make this area a part of their san diego vacation.
Show less
I love Coronado island and visit every chance I get. It is a great place to shop, walk on beach and look at town. So easy to pop over on ferry from San diego

When we arrived there after the big bridge we were amazed at the beauty and cleanliness of the downtown area. We parked along the beach near the hotel and walked up to get breakfast at the cafe at the hotel. We saw the coolest sandcastles on the beach and couldnt wait to have breakfast so we could check them out.
Show less
A Must Visit for Everyone Visiting San Diego

Do not leave San Diego without budgeting time for a visit to Coronado Island. A trip over the free 2.1 mile Coronado Bridge (which my granddaughter lovingly refers to as the Blue Bridge) gives you a wonderful view of San Diego Bay to the right and looking out toward the Pacific to the left. The view of sailboats to the right and large U.S. Naval vessels to the left is awesome. Coronado Island is picturesque and includes beautiful parks, beaches, homes, and shopping areas. Don't exceed 30 miles here or risk a speeding ticket. You will see both locals and visitors travelling the roads in golf carts . A visit to Ferry Landing Park affords excellent restaurants and walkways overlooking San Diego Bay and the San Diego skyline. Orange Avenue boasts many restaurants with both indoor and outdoor seating as well as shops of all kinds. Allow time for a stop and visit at the historic Hotel Del Coronado, founded in 1888. Visit the gift shop and learn about the resident ghost. Have a drink on the veranda to watch the sun set over the Pacific. A drive down the Strand, the road which connects the Isthmus to Imperial Beach boasts beautiful beaches and views of wetlands. Good for a day trip or better yet a stay of several days and nights. We return to Coronado Island every time we visit San Diego.
Show less
Sitting at the dock of the bay
Love just sitting at the beach and watch the world go by. It was a little to cool for us to go in the water but I am sure it would be wonderful.
Unique California beach town minutes from downtown San Diego
Great beaches, bike friendly beach town with good restaurants and lots to do. Nice for a day trip but nicer to stay a couple of nights.

Great place to spend New Years or anytime of the year. Lots of cute boutiques, restaurants and bars. Kid friendly. You can walk from hotel del Coronado and be downtown in about 10 minutes or rent a golf cart and drive around to take in the sites. Tons of fun and lots of things to do.
Show less
Absolutely charming! You feel as though you have stepped back in time. There is an amazing history to this island and much beauty.

Took a Lyft over to the beach from the ferry. Awesome beach and beautiful sunset. Walked back to ferry. Came up group after group of the rudest pedestrians of my life. Prob not locals. But sharing the sidewalks was not in their set of skills.

Wow, what a place!

I had spare time after a business trip and came here for a few hours before flying out.

Best decision of the entire week.

I rented a bike and took it for a spin for a couple of hours around the Island's beaches, neighborhoods, a drink on the beach and lunch.

Paradise, basically. Clean, safe, friendly, all-round amazing for young and old, groups and solo.

I cannot wait to be back there. No, to live there!

A total must visit
Show less

Coronado Island is a nice ferry trip across from San Diego. There are many shops, restaurants, and of course the Del Coronado hotel is a must see. Definitely a nice day trip if you're visiting San Diego
I loved the small town feeling of Coronado Island. You can walk easily almost anywhere, including the ferry to slip over to San Diego. Fabulous food options abound!

I live here so maybe bias. However - this would be a great day get away for the family. Recommend getting here early for parking - and start around hotel Del area for great beach access. Restaurant are a plenty and great quality.
Recommend heading this way early and getting breakfast at brueggers bagels!!

Show less
Great place to visit. The views when coming over the bridge are amazing. The beach is kept really clean and is great for a walk along or to watch sunset. A must when in San Diego.
Coronado island is beautiful, great places and views and water! But it is not that easy to find parking...
One of our favorite/must see places to come

We love Coronado Island (which is not technically an island). From the different shops (ranging from ice cream, bars, restaurants, and sweet shops) on the street to a great beach. We like to go to the beach in front of the Del Coronado Hotel since you can grab food or use the restrooms. We come off season so street parking is manageable. If you drive south on I-75 you may get to see some Navy Seals training or you can also sit on the beach and watch planes land at the nearby navy base.
Show less

We were on our last day in the USA from Australia and had the day to explore the San Diego area. I've always wanted to cross the 'big bridge' but was unsure where it went and what was there to see. What we discovered was an amazing little 'village'. I only wish we had more time to look around and explore.....maybe next time!
Show less

We made an afternoon trip to Coronado to check out the famous hotel (Some Like It Hot is my favorite film!), and walk the beach. The trip across the bridge was fun, but oh the scenery from the beach looking back to the Hotel Del Coronado left me almost speechless. There was a large wedding party going on, complete with the bride and her new groom taking pictures in the surf-- complete in their wedding attire! This was fun to watch, as was the other families strolling up and down the walk. We of course went in and walked around the hotel, which had a gift shop and lots of mementos of different hotel events over the years. This little trek was one of my favorite times in our San Diego trip.
Show less

If you are visiting San Diego, then visiting Coronado is a must! It has great clean beach, and ideal place for kids to spend a day on the beach. The only downside is the lack of any toilets, but else it is good. The little walk around the town is a must, with wonderful shops and restaurant. Gelato Paradiso is a good place to have some ice cream.
Show less

My husband and I spent a week in Coronado in July. We enjoyed wonderful restaurants and shopping opportunities. The beach was relaxing and filled with families enjoying their time together. There were local friendly law enforcement officers community policing the more populated areas which was nice to experience.
Overall this area is a family friendly safe place to relax and enjoy family time in a beautiful area of California!
Show less
Great place to hike and bike for the day
Whether you're walking or renting a bike and riding there is plenty to see and do on the island. Stop by hotel de Coronado for lunch.
Beautiful island, beaches, hotels, and Ferry Service1

The most fun way to get to the island is by ferry - from the San Diego Convention Center or from the cruise dock area. Once at the ferry landing, you can walk to the downtown area and the beach (and the Del Coronado Hotel) in about 25 minutes; or grab a taxi. Driving can be a hassle - over the toll bridge into heavy traffic and difficult parking. A taxi from San Diego cost about $20. The shopping/dining area near the ferry landing is a destination in itself. You can also rent a bike and cycle south on a bike path to Silver Strand State Beach (about 4 miles). The Island is a wonderful escape from San Diego .
Show less
Very popular place for a nice stroll on the spacious beach and perhaps a visit to the beautiful, iconic landmark of the island, Hotel del Coronado.

Great spot for a day trip while visiting San Diego, accessible by car via bridge, or by ferry from downtown San Diego. Boutique shops, large choice of restaurants, lovely beaches, photogenic skyline of San Diego, historic Hotel del Coronado to visit, and even ice skating in winter, overlooking the beach!
Show less

Coronado Island has beautiful beaches, and the Del Coronado is a lovely historical spot to visit. Be warned that everything at the Del costs noticeably more than other spots on the island. The ferry trip over from San Diego is cheap and easy, and you can have a nice lunch at the brewery, or just grab ice cream and wander around a bit.
Show less

This is now officially my happy place. Coronado is SoCal on slow burn. A strip of golden California coast where the beaches are long, the sand fine and San Diego is just a ride over the bridge or a 15 minute ferry ride.

We crossed the bridge to Coronado to see the hotel and ended up eating lunch on Orange St. What a great spot. My wife and I want to come back to hit the beech. It's $30 to park just to go inside and view the Coronado hotel so I drove around in circles for 20 minutes while the family ran in to see the upside down Christmas tree. Beautiful spot but stupid money to stay there.
We enjoyed the shops and restaurants on Orange St. Need area with a cool vibe. We will be back!
Show less
Very upscale and gorgeous place. Beautiful beaches and the Del Coronado is always worthwhile to swing by.

Coronado is a beautiful spot to visit however it is extremely crowded at certain times
If you don't arrive quite early and with dinner reservations you may have difficulty finding a place to dine at
The beach is beautiful Lots of people having professional photos taken because it is quite breathtaking
The boardwalk is this horrible cement path that is horrible to walk on
I think it is ok for biking or rollerblading but not for strolling
In fact there is a lot of cement paths all over the place Kind of hard on your joints
Coronado seems safe People are pretty nice
It would be so much better if it had an actual wooden boardwalk
Show less

We love to stay on Coronado Island... It is quaint. If you don't like driving over the bridge, that could be a problem! There are ferries that go back and forth, but I don't think they take vehicles. There are lots of restaurants, and places to get good food, and the beach is beautiful. Just be okay with the sounds of jets flying overhead constantly, because that will be your soundtrack of your stay on Coronado Island.
Show less
A wonderful peaceful part of San Diego

We recently spent a week in San Diego. That was our first time there and we spent one day in Coronado. We were staying in the Gaslamp area so we had to decide whether to take the ferry or the public bus. We were also thinking about a harbor cruise for another day so we took the bus. We got off the bus at Orange ave near the ferry stop. We checked out that area and then walked down one side of Orange to the boat launch and Del Coronado Hotel area. We explored all that including walking around the hotel to have a look inside, the skating rink, and the beach. We then walked back on the other side of Orange Ave, ate at a restaurant that was close to the ferry stop, and then caught the bus back to the Gaslamp area right around sunset. It was a nice day with lots of walking and we decided that if we return to San Diego we would like to stay on Coronado Island.
Show less
Been here a few times. I would never hesitate to go back. The beach is well kept. Parking can ba a little dicey but worth the effort. The Del is right there, always a nice stop.
Coronado is a must see when in San Diego

take the bridge over to Coronado and drive down the main drag of town Orange Ave. There are plenty of bars, restaraurnts and shopping. Park the car and walk the town, go over to The Del Coronado and take our shoes off and walk the beach. It is a great place to just take in Southern California.
Show less

The sunset was beautiful! There were so many festivities happening for the holidays or maybe because it was a beautiful Sunday. The water was too cold and rough to swim in but just enjoying the sunset , and running barefoot in the sand was enough for my girls to be very happy . We could have stayed all day !
Show less
We walked the shops and toured the hotel and really enjoyed our day. The hotel was awesome and reading some of its history was exciting. Great views

My husband and I were staying in San Diego and made the trip down to Coronado at sunset. We watched the sun go down from the beach and dipped our toes in the ocean. It was beautiful, and one the most memorable spots from our trip. We found a restaurant at the Hotel del Coronado called ENO Pizzeria and Wine Bar, where the food was delicious, especially the dessert. The hotel area felt like a tropical resort. We didn't want to leave!
Show less
So much to see and do within a short walk wherever you stay. There were great restaurants, the food tour, shopping, the beach, and historical sites all on the island. I would definitely visit again.

Took the ferry from the downtown harbour to Coronado. Trip runs every hour and takes about 15 minutes. The terminal on Coronado is surrounded by a shopping area with lots of restaurant options from coffee and ice cream to fine dining. There is a paved walking path that goes around the island by the water. There is the option to rent bikes as well.
Show less
I am not quite sure what I would recommend it for. It appears to be mostly a bedroom community with little else happening except for the naval base.
We went back twice in the midst of Thanksgiving holidays and it was still easy to park and felt fairly quiet. It’s a lovely beach town and a cosy resort with a traditional vibe.

The Island has its”Own Bank”. How Rich is That? It’s Militarily. How Safe is that? The houses are Not Gated. How Safe is that? THE BEACH IS AT HARMONY WITH THE SEA.? You will never find a Safer and Secure Place In The World. John
Have to stay here at least once in your life
Very cool relaxing island with lots of shops and restaurants, can ride your bike go for a jog, have some drinks on the ocean, etc.
Great vacation spot away from the hubbub
This is a lovely place to visit. You can walk to great shops, great restaurants, spend the day at the beach, or hop the ferry to San Diego.

The perfect beach community. Item number one. The historic Hotel Del Coronado. Item two one of the most beautiful white sand beaches in the US. It’s a public beach. The town itself has numerous restaurants, bars, stores and beautiful homes. It’s a true gem.

My wife and I recently visited Coronado Island with friends. We rode to this beautiful peninsula on the San Diego trolley. We got off and walked around this fantastic beach resort. The views were outstanding and the place is fabulous. We enjoyed our scenic walk and highly recommend this place.
Show less
Want to relax, go to Coronado

Coronado island is only a bridge drive away from San Diego, but had had a whole different feel and attitude. You can spend a day at Dog beach with your buddy or take a look at the historic Hotel Coronado. Pace is slow and relaxing. US Navy constitutes the bulk of the area, so many ships can be seen.
Show less
Best of San Diego--beautiful island-like peninsula over the bridge from San Diego--great restaurants on Orange St.--don't miss sunset @ Hotel Del Coronado Beach.

We hadn't planned to even go to Coronado, but the ferry was there, so we did it! It is a fun little place to grab a bite, do some shopping, or take a self-guided electric bike tour of the island, which I LOVED!!!!

We highly recommend visiting Coronado Island when staying in San Diego. It’s a very pleasant excursion with lots of restaurants and shops. No visit would be complete of course without a visit to the Del Coronado hotel and the ocean side beach. Take the water taxi by Joe’s Crab Shack and save yourself the hassle of driving over. You can easily walk around, rent bicycles, or take the trolley. It’s a great day!
Show less

I had the pleasure of stopping here on my tour of San Diego, I'm glad we did.

As you drive across the bridge there is splendid views of the harbour and city, it really is breathtaking. If you look to your left you can see the coast of Mexico In the far distance it's about 7 miles away.

Once on the island you have the option of grabbing a bite to eat, there are great food places that range from a specialist cupcake shop to a KFC and some other quant different little spots. You can also grab a ferry across the harbour for a tour of the bay. Most of all there is great views of the skyline of San Diego.

When we were there, there were groups of marines in uniform mooching Around also grabbing lunch etc,that view was rather pleasant too. Make sure you go for an hour or two while in San Diego.
Show less

I had seen so many great reviews about this area. It was nice, perhaps my expectations were too high. We were staying in San Diego and I wanted to the Hotel Del Coronado that everyone raved about. I found things to be overcrowded and busy. It was nice but too much for me, perhaps it was just the time of year.
Show less
A cool place just to hang out

Visited San Diego in October during a heat wave, so Coronado Island was the place to go. An Uber driver took us over to the island in no time from Old Town. A great afternoon spent walking, on the beachwalk as well as at the Del in the shops, the bar and people watching. Great destination, next time in San Diego we would like to stay on the Island.
Show less
Nice to stroll around and visit the shops. Hotel is neat to look at. Cute shops a few blocks away. There are sand castle artists nearby.
what a place, few places like this in the US with this feeling of vacation

you would like to go into this place, and dive plently of restaurant, bars, yet a verry nice and family oriented place, with beutiful sigths and amazing places to go and visit, the hotel is a main and a must.
A Good Side Trip From San Diego

The island has a pleasant old-fashioned feel to it and is a pleasant wayto spend some time outside San Diego. Take the 901 bus over the Coronado Bridge and catch the ferry back to either the Convention Center or Broadway Pier.
Such a beautiful place! Rented electric bikes and saw the whole island! Perfect day! Fantastic restaurants...great shopping!

We stayed on the island and enjoyed it very much. We was able to walk everywhere. Beautiful beach on one side and beautiful skyline view of San Diego on the other, and lots of shopping and restaurants.
Lovely beach with many eateries and shops
We had only a limited amount of time in the island but there are plenty restaurants, mcafes and pubs. The beach itself is very large and sandy and there are some high end shops.
A beautiful beach on a beautiful island. On a warm summer day, the beach gets extremely crowded. Hard to find an open towel spot.

Coronado is like no other beach town in So-Cal. Quaint, gorgeous and a small town atmosphere. If you want "big city" its just a 10 min drive over the bridge. Lots of restaurants & attractions. Don't miss the Hotel Del! Spectacular & loaded w/history.

The beac in Coronado goes on for miles and because it’s so big it never looks busy, we did not see any sun beds to rent as it seems people take their own. Water was lovely and not too cold, best part for me was , right by the shore when the water comes in, you can see Gold glistening by the edge and it’s all along the shore, amazing site. The island of Coronado is very pristine and even the grass looks plastic, very well kept place. There is a great deal of walking to be done and some great scenery, we also took a bike ride around the island. There are some great restaurants in Coronado and my favourite was the Stake Chophouse & bar, quite pricy but they do happy hour which was great.There is a Irish pub called McP,s that had a good menu and was full of life.
Show less

Lots to do here especially if you want to shop. Lots of shops and places to,eat on Orange Ave. park your car and enjoy the walk. The hotel del Coronado is a wonder take time to visit if your not staying there. The beaches were amazing. Go by the historical society, the ladies there were helpful and full of advise and fun stories.
Show less

It was very nice to get out and walk along the beach in front of the hotel. The parking situation is difficult and after opting for the Hotel parking we realized at $35 why it was the only thing available — oops!
Lots of easy walking and shops

A bit more touristy than I remember with lots of souvenir shops but there is a good mix of restaurants. There are some midrange hotels that are easy walks from most shops. The Del is touristy but worth a walk through.
I took a bus over to the island from the convention center. I took a boat back to the dock in front of my hotel. The weather was nice and the shopping was fun.

This island is so relaxing there are a ton of restaurants that are not expensive. The history of the island is all around you. The beach is number one plenty of walking or hope on one of the tour buses that makes stops all over San Diego . Great for families.
Show less

Beautiful area of San Diego to visit. Easy access from bus or Ferry. I took the local Ferry, they ran hourly and also a great way to see part of Harbor and Coronado bridge.
Easy access to bus ride over to the beautiful Coronado Hotel, lovely to sit up on the deck with a drink and watch along the promenade and beachfront. Great day out.
Show less
A perfect place for a relaxing and unscheduled trip. But not much going on here, downtown it's nice to walk around. There's a "back to the future" about being here.
My husband and I enjoyed our time spent on Coronado Island! McP's was excellent for lunch and the Hotel Coronado was fun for drinks and appetizers. We loved spending 3 hrs on the beach.
Kick back and see what else southern California has to offer. The island is home to the Hotel Del and the Naval Base. Sit on the beach with a cool drink and watch Naval aviators perform touch & gos.

this was a beautiful island just across from downtown san diego. it was very quaint and peacheful. shopping and restaurants all in walking distance. clean safe family environment. but it also has its own downtown scene.beautiful views and interestings stores to explore. we loved it!
Great small island with lots of history, military and visitors

Coronado Island is an iconic place to visit. You won't miss the Coronado Bridge and Hotel del Coronado, and the beautiful Coronado Beach. You may be curious about the Pacific Fleet of US Navy, which is headquartered on this island, but won't be able to get in. You'll see the vessels and jets often though from a distance.

The island is very neat and fun to visit and spend some time. But expect to see lots of visitors, from local and far away. The famous landmarks are always full of people. But the neighborhood is usually very quiet.

Parking isn't very easy on the island. So make sure not to be ticketed or towed.
Show less
Go See The Xmas Boat Parade

This spot by the ferry landing is the best place to watch the boat parade. You can sit, buy food like BBQ or pizza, and enjoy a coffee while being outdoors on a nice night. We dressed warm, brought snuggle blankets, and arrived early to park for a fee and get a table. We really enjoyed it, and we even walked on the little pier to take pics.
Show less
A fun place for an outing!

Although, one can certainly spend a week here, in my opinion, a day or possibly two would suffice. This spot offers quaint shops, good restaurants, and of course a spectacular beach along with the historic Hotel del Coronado. The nearby naval base also affords opportunities to watch aircraft fly in and out. The highlight of this area is the beach which is quite wide and is characterized by fine sand. A beautiful place particularly at sunset!
Show less
The Isalnd has a GREAT FEEL about it
What a wonderful place to live! Houses look really interesting and the whole place has a quiet contentment. Suspect that it is not cheap.
Excellent beach for a sunny day

Coronado island has very nice houses on the non military part of the island and a beatufil white sand beach to spend the day or just walk about on the beach front. Stop for a few drinks at the Coronado hotel while viewing the ocean.

So interesting to learn about the WWII ship. We did the self guided audio tour. Would be fun for school age children also to walk aboard the ship and listen to audio tour along the way. The grounds are beautiful and there is easy access to parking nearby.
Show less
Beautiful area in san diego. Stayed at the marriott but my favorite id the del coronado. Will be back there in february. Can’t wait
Not to be missed once in San Diego

I've visited Coronado all the first 3 times been in San Diego and I think it shouldn't be missed even staying in SD for work.
Old Coronado hotel is fantastic site, full of wooden interiors and of memories like the old elevator (said to be the very first, installed by T.A Edison) and like all the movie set places of "Some like it hot".
Nice to drink a cocktail looking at the beach, thinking about the wonderful comedy shot here.
Then, walk in the large sand beach and meet people enjoying sea breeze, jogging, playing with their dogs, taking it easy for a while.
Show less
What a lovely place to live, clean, beautiful. Reminded me of Celebration in Florida. Beautiful houses, great views, would love to stay.

Everything about Coronado Island is Perfect!!! Food.. Entertainment... Shopping... Money Value... Island Tours...Local Families and Visitors... And The History of The Coronado Island is Fascinating and Awesome... Then to see ALL of our USA Military Branches UNITE and As ONE to TRAIN is Breath Taking and will Give you Such Pride to be a US Citizen!!!
Show less

I was making my first visit to San Diego and on the first morning drove to Coronado - a place I didn't previously know existed! But I loved it so much that I went back the next day too. And I am already looking forward to my next trip to San Diego to return there.

The town is spotless, with some beautiful houses. The beach is lovely and clean. It's not like some beach towns where the area around the beach is a bit run down. If anything, Coronado is the opposite - showing its best side to the people who visit. There are lots of shops and restaurants to go to too, when you can prise yourself from the beach.

I also loved the drive over the bridge from San Diego. It's hard to imagine that this place is 15 minutes or less away from the bustle of the Gaslamp Quarter.
Show less

I love this location. Close enough to downtown but with an energy of its own. I am glad we chose to stay on this side of San Diego. Great walks, views and restaurants. The sunset park and beach are a must do. Stunning!

Caught the ferry over think it was $5 each? Hired a bicycle for an hour $8 per hour, had a nice ride over to the Hotel Del Coronado and along the beach path. Rode back through the town and after taking the bikes back we had a lovely lunch at Peohe's. The ferry reside was nice, I guess the amazing weather helped the day.
Show less

As we checked almost on a daily basis, prior to our trip, the live camera view from hotel Coronado del Mar, we knew the weather here can be very moody.

Fortunately, as we arrived at the hotel, we had only lovely days and not only we enjoyed the hotel and the great hospitality we encountered here but also visited on a daily basis different parts of the island, more or less as we came/left via Coronado bridge.

I really loved the sleepy atmosphere further away you got from Coronado del Mar hotel with houses still made of wood, which you do not see in the UK and Europe in general and here seem to be the norm. People seem to be very nice and friendly and the 'centre' of the town seem to be around our hotel with lots of restaurants and shops and great road.

The beach is not bad although it does not have the same fine sand you get in Clearwater Florida, our favourite to which we return every year, also the water is not as warm as there.

However this is a great island to visit once in a lifetime.
Show less
Outstanding choice for any stay in San Diego

We loved the laid back atmosphere. A beautiful beach, lovely walks, variety of restaurants from casual to fine dining. Yet easy access to all the things we were doing— ceremony at Navy base, family visit, concert at Spreckels Organ Pavilion in Balboa Park and Gaslamp district.
Show less
This turned out to be one of my favorite all time beaches. The sand actually sparkles in the sunlight. The curve of the beach is also quite romantic

Coronado Island is lovely and the beach is long and wide. In particular, the beach in front of the Del Coronado is public and is wide and very clean. Restaurants are nearby and easy to walk to in addition to those at The Del. Public parking is nearby as well. The lifeguard towers were empty but there were hardly any swimmers in the water anyway. The Del has chairs and umbrellas for rent but they are pricey. We didn't find any public restrooms other than at The Del but we didn't wander far from there either.
Show less

My wife and I took a drive over the bridge to Coronado Island, basically to have lunch at the Hotel del Coronado. But we took a drive through down and to the beaches to enjoy the views. We stopped at Coronado Beach that had benches right near the street so we could sit and view the ocean, very restful. Then it was off to Silver Strand beach for more views before heading back to the Hotel. All in all it was well worth the drive and the time spent enjoying the views.
Show less

We love Coronado Island! We haven't visited for 15 years and we were not disappointed! It's beautiful as ever! We love the beach and ocean. It is so relaxing! We haven't found any great places to eat on the island yet. Always love seeing the Coronado bridge at night. Can't wait to return.
Show less
Simply beautiful. I love this place, and the town is just amazing. I would stay here over San Diego again.

Spent the day walking around and shopping in the sweet boutique shops that of course are over priced. It's a must hike around if you have never been to Coronado island. The beaches are amazing and not many people are there compared to San Diego beaches. Lovely homes and of course the hotel. Go, if you haven't been!!
Show less
Actually an isthmus connected to mainland at the south. Hob nob with retired Navy Admirals. Great place to ride bikes-so perfectly flat.

Beautiful golden sand beach surrounded by cliffs to the north and south. Warm sunshine and the cool pacific ocean was just plain good for the soul. I didn't do any activities, but walked by the famous hotel (a gorgeous wedding was happening on the beach!), watched a surf school in the water, and had lunch at a nearby pizza place (The Village (??) - tasty). Peaceful. Sun, fresh air, ocean, and a breeze...can't ask for much more.

Was an easy/quick drive from the airport car rental place. Definitely worthy of checking out while in San Diego! Ocean Drive had meters for parking, but I had no problem parking off the main strip on a residential block for free.
Show less

Been here a few times staying mostly at the Navy Lodge on North Island. Walk the beaches in the am carrying my coffee. The city beaches are dragged and groomed each morning to remove seaweed and beach debris. Always a nice casual walk but finding seashells can be iffy at times.
Show less

I had rented a motorcycle for this portion of my stay in San Diego and decided to cool off in Coronado which turned out awesome. Word the average water temperature for summer was around the higher 50s so exercise some caution when bathing. Nonetheless the beach is gorgeous with it's white sand and plentiful waves. If you're truly lucky you'll catch Navy SEAL trainees during exercises on the beach.
Show less

Back in the day when I was a kid in San Diego, Coronado was the community where naval commanders and the wealthy lived. It is still a enclave for the wealthy. It is still a beautiful community. I still want to live there. If you ever visit San Diego, you must cross San Diego Bay and visit this beautiful place!
Show less

Staying on the island was perfect. After sightseeing San Diego area it was wonderful to return to a slower pace for our evenings. We stayed in a small boutique hotel, Hotel Marisol, near the Del Coronado. Walking to shops, restaurants and the beach.
Super cute place . Went over on the ferry , unfortunately it was dusk so most places were closing but still worth it. I think next time we will go earlier in the day to explore some more .
From the bridge to get there to the beautiful white sand beach to the stately Del Coronado hotel to the lovely town, this place is worth a visit when you are in San Diego. Totally different.
It is worth it to come to the island. The shops are a little high in price but the houses and beaches are great.

While in the San Diego area- it is definitely worth the drive over the bridge to the beautiful island of Coronado! Lots of shops and restaurants- take a walk down Orange Avenue and visit the famous Del Coronado! Or visit the beautiful beaches here! Great views, beautiful homes, lots to do!!
Show less
Love either renting chairs or just a towel on the beach. Long walks were also great. Clean, cold water and loved every minute of it.

This is one of the best place in San Diego. Plan to visit this island when you visit here. The beach here has white sand and there is a trail by the side of del Coronado hotel which adds to the beauty of this place. Must visit !!!
Show less
I love, love this place❤ From the brigde to get over there to the beautiful beach, homes, parks, local stores and exquisite cuisine. Lovely experience near San Diego.
Worth visiting while in the San Diego area.

This narrow strip of land has the cityscape on one side and the beach/ocean view on the other side. About 2 miles apart so easy to walk or bike. Most drinks, shops, meals are near the Ferry dock, on Orange Street or near the Historical, Del Coronado Hotel.
Show less

well this place is just amazing. it has the most wonderful and massive beach, the houses are beautiful and the place oozes class. I wish I could live there! the bridge you cross from San Diego to get there is just mad and the views amazing. If you are passing nearby you must pop in here
Show less
Lovely area and beautiful Beach. Hotel Del has great food, drink and MooTime ice-cream. Sooo relaxing, wonderful.

Lovely little place with beaches, restaurants & shops. Short drive over the bridge from downtown San Diego. Visit the Hotel Del Coronado if you have time, it's beautiful & has an interesting history linked to movies & Christmas trees.
Lovely peninsular with a pretty town and stores. Lots of restaurants. Beautiful silver sands beach and the bay. Stay here for a break from the city
Great Island over an amazing bridge this is the quieter side although 10-15 mins over to city side by ferry
Amazing little island with adventures for the entire family! Enjoy yourself and relax at the beach aw some time at thenohannafest

Considering moving to San Diego? Move to Coronado. Homes are all well kept up, yards are pristine, surrounded by water, great restaurants and so easy to get to downtown San Diego. Getting to the airport and beaches is just as easy.
Wonderful "Get out of the Heat" Vacation

We rented a small house and stayed for three weeks. The weather was absolutely perfect - between 74 and 75 degrees and sunny. The beaches are some of the best in the country. We especially enjoyed the "Dog Beach. Great restaurants of all kinds plus many tours. The free concerts in the park were really fun. Bottom line - GREAT SUMMER VACATION SPOT!!
Show less
Took a ferry to Coronado Rented a Surrey Walked through the shops by the ferry landing We had a great time

Quaint, lovely island peninsula to drive through. Streets lined with trees, shops, restaurants. Nice to walk downtown and check it all out. Ferry's Landing was a great place to check out, too. We almost missed it as it was off the beaten path a little, but was a lovely village with great restaurants right on the water with a view of San Diego in the distance
Show less

My family visited Coronado Island while on vacation in San Diego. We loved it. The drive over the Coronado Bridge is spectacular. Great views of the water and downtown San Diego. We spent the day on the beach, which was beautiful, a long sandy beach. Unfortunately, the water was full of seaweed. Our legs were completely tangled up in it. I don’t know if the water is always full of seaweed or if it was due to a storm. We set up our chairs near the main lifeguard station where the restrooms are. The restrooms were very clean. There are also outside showers for rinsing off the sand before you leave. While we were there, quite a few military jets and cargo planes flew overhead landing at their base on nearby Point Loma. They fly very low over the beach which was really cool to experience. Later in the day we walked down to tour the Hotel Del Coronado. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and definitely worth a visit. While we were there, we stopped and had happy hour at one of the hotel’s bars. Even at happy hour the drinks were expensive - $9 for a beer and $18 for margarita. We had packed our own lunch but on the drive to the beach I noticed a slew of restaurants on Coronado’s main street. We were there on a Saturday and the area was packed. As far as I could tell, there were not any parking lots near the beach. We drove around for 30 minutes before we found a parking spot. I did notice a parking lot near the restaurant district. We enjoyed ourselves so much that we went back later in the week.
Show less
Come see the hotel where "Some Like it Hot" was filmed. It's quite amazing. And this island is charming, beaches and pretty houses with gardens. Good for biking.
Recommend to add a stop here for your trip

We loved this place! We were staying downtown so took the ferry across (I think $5 each) and the took a Lyft back which was like $8.

Once there we took the free shuttle bus to the beach! We walked around a bit but not much prior. The beach is lovely and even though it was busy never felt crowded as it is sooo huge!

As the military is close a fighter jet flew by and then looped around and did some fancy maneuvers before landing which was neat. When we finished we took the free shuttle back and stopped at Nicky Rottens which we liked a lot before going to the grocery store which is near the Ferry and grabbing a few things before taking a Lyft back to the hotel. If you don't get to the other beaches (we went to Ocean/Mission) I would definitely say make this a stop or better all of them a visit as we liked them all!
Show less

We spent a couple of hours here. We found a beautiful place to walk along the water. There are numerous such paths in the area. The only problem with this is is that it was somewhat short. I think there might be others very nearby but I'm not sure
Show less

In the past, we've always used the ferry to travel from San Diego to the island but this time we used the bridge because of a tight schedule for dinner reservations. Parking is a little difficult to find so the ferry is a better choice. Coronado and the views are San Diego from the island are gorgeous. Highly recommend Peohe's restaurant for a great meal while you are on the island. Loved relaxing by the ferry landing and listening to live music.
Show less
The drive over the Coronado Bridge is spectacular - high views over the water and city. The highlight of the island is the Coronado Hotel - an old hotel that sits right on the beach.
This island is well kept and very beautiful. Many nice restaurants and hotel accomodations. It was hot that day but so many different historical things to see
Take a walk on the seaside. Its a nice place to spend an afternoon. The beaches are really nice, and the wether is great

Coronado is truly beautiful. Bike friendly, pet friendly and has a beautiful view of the San Diego skyline. Walking at night time is the perfect way to see the buildings and Coronado bridge lit up with the lights.
We took a late afternoon walk around the island. It is very picturesque with well kept buildings, colorful gardens, quaint shops,lovely beaches and coastal views.
Must visit every time I am in San Diego!

I cannot rave enough about how much I enjoy going to Coronado Island. I love the beach, the Del, the shops and cafes, looking at the million dollar homes, and just walking around this peaceful, beautiful island. I have stayed at the Del for NYE previously, but even if you do not stay there, you can walk around the lobby and visit the shops and restaurants. The beach is lovely on Coronado, and the bay side over at Ferry Landing offers nice views and eats, too. Take the ferry over or drive across the bridge. I highly recommend eating on the island and spending several hours here.
Show less

I've never been to Coronado Island and it was a great little adventure for my wife and I along with our good friends that we usually travel with on get away weekends. There's loads of wonderful places to eat (Chez Loma, Peohe's, Old town, Cosmopolitan Hotel) and great beaches. We toured through the Visitors Center, which gives you a wealth of info about SD and it's history. We went to Municipal Beach, and styed at the Cherooke Lodge, which was a lot of fun. Also there are a LOT of shops to hit on Orange Ave. with a lot of "Stuff" that you won't see anywhere else. Most everything was in walking distance so you don't need to worry about parking, which by the way is quite tight most of the time. Once you get a parking spot you don't give it up. It's a great little trip for So. Californians, next time we're going to take the AmTrak to add to the adventure. JUST DO IT!
Show less
Did a girls trip here for a relaxing weekend. Very good weather, and stayed right next to the bay. Everything was walking distance which was great. Love this little island.

This is a unique beach because of the gold flecks in the sand. It almost looks like glitter was sprinkled in the surf! We found a few shells, but the overall feeling of the beach was truly like a step back in time.
Had a wonderful time at Coronado Island would recommend anybody to go there! The town is very pretty lots of restaurants and bars the people are super friendly and I had a great time!
Coronado Island and its hotel is not to be missed. Great dining and a lovely town to explore. Must try Restaurant 1500.
Coronado is lovely and makes for a great day trip. Good food, shops, and of course the beach. I would love to return and stay at the Hotel Del Coronado.

I love San Diego. I live here. But it is always such a treat to make our way across the bridge oron the ferry to the "village" of Coronado. Everything is within walking or biking distance.
Great food.
Classic hotels
World class beach
Concerts in the park
Sailing
Kayaking
Local brewery
If you have been to SD without making it to Coronado you've missed part of our city's charm.

Parking can be difficult.
Show less

Always wonderful!! Love the history and ocean beauty from our room and the roof top! My husband loves the spa, sauna and the gym. Fresh coffee every morning and of course a visit with Cody the parrot!

Coronado is a beautiful beach area with great shopping and restaurants. It's easy to park ( for free) and just enjoy the area. The hotels are beautiful and worth a walk through. It's a nice contrast to the hubbub of the city.

Coronado is a premium place to travel to. From San Diego you can go by boat across the bay. When you dock there are restaurants and shops. You can also rent bikes. Very nice and affordable. Take your family to see the sites. A clean place. Love the beach.
Show less

I had a lot of expectations but unfortunately I had got disappointed. We took a bike ride and with 1 hour is enough to ride all the island. Why? Mainly because there is a military Base that take the half of the island. Beaches are good but too much tiny sand which I personally don't like. My feeling this is a good place to spend some hours with the family, see and go to another place.
Show less
Excellent place to visit with your family prolactin beautiful I love that I go every year It's beautiful in August
Everything you need in this island

Though not a true island, it sure feels like it. Great restaurants and many activities to do. Great ocean beaches and nice bay activities. Surprised with nice quality of good Restaurants. From Italian to Japanese we found excellent choices. Very close to downtown San Diego and La Jolla too. You'll have a great time with your vacation!
Show less
Make sure you see Coronado island and the hotel. Just a great cheap visit. Go to visitors center and drive to the south of the island.
Cute little place interesting history. worth a drive by and see the hotel it is historical and pretty cool
This is a nice location with lots of to do. This is a good family or romantic location. There are good restaurants and shops.
A must see when in the San Diego area

Just a couple of miles from downtown San Diego over the toll-free Coronado Bay bridge and you are in a quaint seaside community. Travel down the main drag of Orange Avenue and you will find many fine restaurants and shops. A visit to the Island would not be complete without stopping in at the historic Hotel Del Coronado first opened in 1888. Stroll the white sand beaches in front our sip a cocktail in one of the ocean view bars. There are several other beautiful hotels and bed & breakfast locations in the area also. The U.S.Navy"s North Island air base is located on the island so you may be treated to the sights and sounds of freedom.
Show less

Quick visit while traveling for a conference. Loved the soft white sandy beach very clean not crowded. We walked downtown area lots of nice shops and restaurants. Would definitely like to return for a romantic stay.
A Must See when in San Diego

You could easily spend a full day here.The Flagship ferry costs $10 return approx. and you can take a bicycle for free.The main attraction of the Coronado hotel and beach is on the opposite side of where the ferry docks.The Jacaranda trees that line the streets made the whole experience wonderful.At your service D&T.
Show less
Fantastic location during a San Diego trip

Having seen San Diego from a little experience, I'm chafed that we spent only one afternoon at Coronado.
This is a beautiful area influenced with Navy folk and seemingly very safe.
There are several trendy eateries on Orange St as well as shops that rent out wet suits, surf boards and bicycles.
I sincerely recommend staying here for 2 nights.
Show less
If I'd have seen it during day, I guarantee you that it's probably one of the most beautiful places ever! Just hearing the surf at that beach made me fall in love with it. :)
Best place in the San Diego area.. Beaches are cleaner with less people. Area has a nice small town feel.

Visit Coronado Island for a lovely day at the beach. Make sure you go to the Hotel del Coronado. There are restaurants and bars at the hotel. I went on a busy day in June, but still enjoyed the water and sun. This is a popular destination.
Show less

It was beautiful island and easy access from San Diego downtown. I traveled with my mom and we had great memory there. recommended time to visit is sunset time. you will see most beautiful sunset over the sea.
Enjoyed the island. Biking is very easy here. It's very beautiful and lots to do and see. We stayed at the Marriott which is quieter and less busy, but has lots of activities.

We came to San Diego for Comic-Con but chose to stay on Coronado instead of down by the convention center. This was the best decision of the trip. The island is like another world so well maintained, beautiful homes, landscaping. Tiny little shops & local restaurants. Most everything is walkable too. Our only complaint is most everything & I mean everything is closed by 9pm 10 at the latest, even fast food. We actually had to go to Vons grocery one night to eat after getting back from convention at 10pm. The shops close between 5-7 as well. Overall though the island is beautiful! We are Caribbean beach people, even Hawaii does not do it for us...so the beach here is very much like most of the west coast or Miami Beach on the east coast in our opinion. So if you like any of those you'll enjoy the water here too.
Show less
Loved this island, stayed at the Coronado which is walking distance to the town. The locals were friendly, the restaurants in town were great. We will be back.
Coronado Island certainly feels like a small town. Lots of local activities welcoming residents and travelers alike.
Enjoyed the beach while we were here! The surf was beautiful and the breeze was cool and refreshing! This is a nice stop while in San Diego!

Just a quick drive over the Coronado bridge (or you can take a ferry to the island) this a must do when in San Diego. There is shopping on Orange ave, everything from boutiques to souvenir shops. Stop by the classic Hotel Del Coronado just off the Coronado beach. The Crown Room has a fabulous, although pricey, Sunday brunch that is worth the experience. The Coronado Beach provides views of downtown San Diego and has amazingly soft sand. The beach stretches along the coast allowing for lots of people and provides a great spot to spend some time at the beach, or just go for a stroll if you are tighter on time. There are lots of great dining options allowing for a full day getaway.
Show less

Lovely island close to San Diego downtown. Beautiful beaches and restaurants along the bay. The town is small and quaint. Very clean and the people are friendly. Safe to walk around and explore. Huge navy base close by so many helicopters frequently fly above across the shore. Definitely worth a visit if you are heading to San Diego
Show less
Great beach & nice dunes. Can be noisy with all the Navy planes & helicopters, especially during the week

It's very nice to see the island as well you can see the famous Coronado Hotel where Marilyn Monroe filmed the movie " Some Like it Hot". If you want to see the hotel, park outside, they free parking otherwise the parking at the hotel is extremely expensive.
I recommend to see the beautiful beach and walk all around, it's a very nice area.
Show less
We enjoyed walking around Hotel De Coronado and visiting the nearby beach. Gorgeous area and setting, just very busy.

It is hard finding a parking place on Coronado Island. Read signs carefully. Very beautiful area, easy access to the beach and lots going on. Enjoyed strolling the street and doing some window shopping, there are cafes and little restaurants. Overall an enjoyable afternoon.
Spent 3 nights here and loved the laid back atmosphere. Beautiful boardwalk and plenty of dining options. Convenient for cycling too. Highly recommended.
Beautiful, clean, trendy equals pure pleasure

What an incredible Island, each view is postcard worthy! Took the Ferry from San Diego, to Coronado. The moment you disembark the islands beauty surrounds you. Trendy stores offering the latest fashions, chic restaurants and fun bars await! Actually the food is reasonably priced for the island.
Bikes are available for rent, but there is a free trolley that takes you to the downtown area and Hotel del Coronado.
Bikes are not allowed on the sidewalks, there is a lot of traffic, which makes biking a little dangerous in congested areas.
The white sand beach spreads across a large area of the island. Beach chairs cost $20. Each so bring your own.
There are inexpensive restaurants on the island, Burger King and Kentucky Fried Chicken, so you don't have to spend a lot of money!
Show less

In my opinion, no trip to San Diego would be complete without a visit to Coronado. The drive across the Coronado Bridge alone is worth the trip. The island is beautiful and is almost completely rimmed with gorgeous beaches. The beaches are cleaner and kept up better than most other SoCal beaches. Also, the sand is full of mica which is very rare for a beach. It makes the sand look like it's full of flecks of gold.

Parking can be an issue, so do your homework before you visit but nearly everything on Coronado is within walking distance due to the island being relatively small. Besides the beaches, it's full of great shops and restaurants. You also have to check out the Hotel Del Corondo. Incredible!

Coronado is the perfect place to spend a day... or longer.
Show less
Food truck, beach, sit down lunch and shoe score

Day trip to the Island. We parked near Birkenstock store and checked it out first my husband found a comfy pair of size 14 sandals. Always hard to find appropriate sizes. Walked to beach and I had a breakfast burrito at HolyMolyGuacamole truck. Walked back to town and checked out Coronado brewery. Great trip.
Show less

Took the ferry across to Coronado from SD one lovely afternoon. Had a very tasty bite to eat then proceeded to walk to the Coronado hotel from the ferry.

You don't have to do this, there is a free shuttle which takes you there, but I do like to take in the sights on foot.

We walked down Orange and stopped at a lovely children's playground and park for our 6 year old to vent some energy!

Our final destination was the famous Coronado hotel, then we took the free shuttle back.

All in all a beautiful island and a must see if in SD.
Show less
Very nice spot for walking if you're in San Diego, a chance to see how the others are living. Nice beach and relaxed atmosphere.

In addition to a wide variety of shops and restaurants, the island offers beautiful architecture. The Hotel del Coronado is a "must see", with beautiful grounds and a nice beach. Orange Avenue through downtown is a great place to spend a few hours, but visit some of the side streets to view a variety of building architecture. It can get crowded in summer, but we found parking by searching for tips online. We arrived before 11am and found good parking just off of Orange Ave within minutes.
Show less
Beach and is so smooth and fine

We just a few hours there just to see how the place is like. It's a beautiful place, and the sand is so fine and smooth. It's very hard There are lots of people. If you can find parking, it's only .25 an hour, very reasonable. It is very hard to find bathrooms along the beach. Lots of signs warning people that everything is for patrons only, which is understandable. It's business. The visitor is the only place we know if that has public bathrooms, but it's not on the beach, and it closes early. There foot rinses on the beach. It looks like it's for the people who stay there, but others were using them. If you drive down toward the other end of the island, there are other little parks. Close by is a little beach on the bay side for little kids with a playground, lifeguard, bathroom, foot rinse, shower. We drove all the way to the other end of the island and found a Costco in a nearby town, but it was a big loop back to San Diego.
Show less

Beautiful, historic, quaint, and full of fun things to do ! The free Island shuttle runs all day; stopping every 20 minutes at 8 locations. The ferry ride across the bay is an excellent way to travel-no need to worry about parking or traffic and the shuttle takes you all around the Island. The Beautiful Hotel Del Coronado is a MUST SEE! The shops, restaurants, and beaches are stunning! The Sand Castle Man is always building something amazing on the beach. A wonderful trip back in time where kids still ride bikes on the streets and families are playing in the sand. A magical vacation spot that is difficult to leave! ❤️
Show less

Would have loved to spend more time here but it was so crowded. No place to park. I think you need to plan to be here very early if you come. Not ideal place for families with kids, in my opinion. Better place for young and singles.
Show less

So much to do! Walk the beach, shop the unique shops, sail, take a gondola ride, wind surf or paddle board. Have a picnic listening to the band playing in the gazebo, get up and dance! Ride on the varied bike paths. Enjoy the varied foods offered at the many restaurants. Enjoy the sea breeze. Enjoy yourself!
Show less
We will most definitely go back!Also we will continue to recommend others to travel to the same spot!

Our stay at the 1906 Lodge on Coronado Island was special,and a trip to certainly remember! The calm of the environs, the attitude and friendliness of the populace,along with the inviting foods, made it all exceptional and worth while!
We had teenagers and kids under 12. Loved everything. Lots to do. Golf carts, bikes, kid friendly activities and restaurants. Patricia Ryan

Coronado Island is a must see when visiting San Diego. It's a quaint little island that is easy to get to buy a car or by Ferry. There are many little restaurants and shops that'll keep you busy throughout the day. It's a great place to stay for vacation and allows you to enjoy the island feel but at the same time the ability to get to the city very quickly.
Show less
A must see in San Diego area!
What beautiful views from here. A nice little downtown area. Had such a good feel to it. Do not skip this on your trip! Words cannot describe it.
Treat Yourself to a SEAL Haven

Coronado Island is a true dichotomy in life. It is the home of the US Navy Special Warfare School (BUD/S), the Hotel Del Coronado - for the rich and famous, and NAS North Island. All of this is packed into one tiny island at the end of a massive bridge, the Coronado Span.
If conditions permit, go see the Brown Shoe Navy Coastal Riverine Museum boats on display.
This is a sharp contrast to the USS Midway
Show less

Stunning. Super relaxed, everyone is friendly. Little bit of a yuppie vibe in the major resorts, but still everyone was quite friendly. Great beaches, good food, gorgeous sunset. Random trolley tours which were adorable, and free shuttles to places. Nice for a few days. Very relaxing!
Show less
